thread.title: Premier League Club Made Enquiry About Riyad Mahrez In January

title: Premier League Club Made Enquiry About Riyad Mahrez In January

organizations.name: premier league club made enquiry about riyad mahrez in january premier league club

text:
Premier League Club Made Enquiry About Riyad Mahrez In January Tue Feb 07 2017 00:06:48 GMT+0000 (GMT) Tue Feb 07 2017 00:06:48 GMT+0000 (GMT) Jack Kenmare Jack Kenmare in football 
From PFA Player of the Year to relegation dog fight, Riyad Mahrez will surely be wondering if he made the right decision by staying with Leicester City, and it turns out a Premier League club wanted him just last month. 
It turns out Tottenham Hotspur made an enquiry about the winger, but Leicester straight up rejected any sort of contact by telling Spurs that he wasn't for sale at any price. 
Mahrez has failed to recapture the form of last season, but that didn't stop Mauricio Pochettino's side in making contact with Leicester, according to The Times. 
The 25-year-old has, however, scored four goals in five Champions League group games this season. 
He also scored two goals in three games for Algeria in the African Cup of Nations last month. - Champions League (@ChampionsLeague) January 15, 2017 
While Jamie Vardy turned down a move to Arsenal, the Algerian reportedly caught the eye of European giants Barcelona after Mahrez bagged 17 goals in the 2015/16 season, a truly impressive feat. 
Do you think he regrets not moving away from the King Power? Or can Leicester recover from their poor run of form? 
Let us know your thoughts. Sponsored Links
